column4: gfather1 Video options dont show up in the new ubuntu version on reconfigure command..
Well that explains it then. lol what do I do instead?
Yea i had that same problem, What card do you have and whats the problem ?
it is an Averatec 3270, whatever video card comes in that... information is a bit lacking but what i've found is Viachrome
And what issues do you have with it
It doesn't detect the video card, just uses vga, max resolution is 800x600 which unfortunately doesn't seem compatible with even most of the default apps
allright. do you know how to copy your xorg.conf ?
ya, want me to put it in pastebin?
Please :)
willluongo.pastebin.com
in the meantime i found out your video card is a VIA/S3 Unichrome Pro IGP
Sweet, thanks!
Ill look around for a solution hold on
Thanks so much for your help
Just to be sure, there is no restricted driver available right ?
Not that I have been able to find... admittedly I am not very good with synaptic, as most of my experience is apt-get and Adept...
Check here : System->Administrator->Restricted drivers manager
I also possible found a forum post that will fix your problems
did you try this : sudo-apt get install xserver-xorg-driver-via
I sure did not, but I am going to now! :D
Will have to restart X after that ( just do a complete restart just to be sure ya know )
Let me know how that worked ou
I will, brb
